revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = ARM7TDMI-S |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 200 |is_doc = |bus = 32-bit |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Macronix;MX29LV800BTC-90; |flash1size = 1 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 8 |ram1chip = SK hynix;HY57V643220CT-6; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Marvell;88E8052; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:80:C8 |oui = 00:80:C8 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = ThreadX;;; |exp_if_types = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = b |defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = |defaultssid = default |defaultssid_regex = ^default$ |default_ch = |manuf = Global Sun |manuf_model = GL2422RT-0T2 |manuf_rev = V1.0 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 08/30/2002 |estreldate = 2002 |estprice = |upc = 790069244872 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B000068UY6 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = Taiwan |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = |rad1modif = unknown |rad1chip1 = Texas Instruments;ACX100; |rad1chip2 = RFMD;; |rad1chip3 = |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b |rad1b = 22 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "GL2422RT-0T2-B03 V1.0" is silkscreened on the board. :"GL2422T4 V1-1" (and probably some other stuff) is silkscreened on the wireless module's board (under its shield). :The board is using all '''STONE''' branded radial capacitors. [http://www.dslreports.com/forum/remark,7447974~root=dlink~mode=flat On DSL-Reports (pictures and comparison between revs. A and B)]
[http://web.archive.org/web/20030625202108/http://www.x123.info/?menu=614 On x123.info]
[http://hri.sourceforge.net/hw/index.html On the HRI hardware table] :OS noted as '''ThreadX''' The default SSID is '''default'''. :Possible 00:40:05 and 00:80:C8 OUIs... The stock firmware is based on ThreadX RTOS. The FCC ID appears to be invalid. {{WiFiCert|W000569|08/12/2002}} ==Links of Interest== *[http://support.dlink.com/emulators/di614plus/ Interface emulator] [[Category:English Documentation]]
